translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor
One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor
God himself created the true Guru Nanak.
Becoming Sikh of the Guru, Guru Angad joined this family.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਸਿਖੁ ਹੈ ਗੁਰ ਅਮਰੁ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਭਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Gurasikhu Hai Gur Amaru Satigur Bhaaiaa.
translation: Liked by the true Guru, Guru Amar Das became Sikh of the Guru.
Then Ram Das, the Sikh of the Guru came to be known as the Guru.
Thereafter came Guru Arjan as the disciple of the Guru (and got established as the Guru).
Hargobind, the Sikh of the Guru cannot remain concealed even if somebody wishes to (and this further means that all the Gurus had the same light).
All the Gurus had the same light
The Gurmukh (Guru Nanak) by becoming the philosopher's stone made all the disciples venerable.

gurmukhi: ਅਸਟ ਧਾਤੁ ੲਿਕੁ ਧਾਤੁ ਜੋਤਿ ਜਗਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Asat Dhaatu Iku Dhaatu Joti Jagaaiaa.
translation: He illumined the people of all the varnas as the philosopher's stone converts all the right metals into gold.
By becoming sandalwood he made all the trees fragrant.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਸਿਖੁ ਸਿਖੁ ਗੁਰ ਹੋੲਿ ਅਚਰਜੁ ਦਿਖਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Gurasikhu Sikhu Gur Hoi Acharaju Dikhaaiaa.
translation: He accomplished the wonder of making disciple the Guru.
Extended his light similarly as a lamp is lit by another lamp.
As the water mixing with water becomes one, likewise deleting ego, the Sikh merges into the Guru.
The gurmukh

transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Janamu Satiguru Paaiaa.
translation: The life of that Gurmukh is successful who has met the true Guru.
The Gurmukh who has surrendered before the Guru is a blest one and his fate is perfect one.
The true Guru, by giving him place around his feet has made him remember the name (of the Lord).

gurmukhi: ਘਰ ਹੀ ਵਿਚਿ ੳੁਦਾਸੁ ਨ ਵਿਅਾਪੈ ਮਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Ghar Hee Vichi Udaasu N Viaapai Maaiaa.
translation: Now being detached, he remains at home and maya does not affect him.
By putting into practice the teachings of the Guru, he has realised he invisible Lord.
Losing his ego, the Guru-orientated Gurmukh has become liberated though still embodied.
The Gurmukhs only sustain the anbearable cup of love

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਅਾਪ ਗਵਾੲਿ ਨ ਅਾਪੁ ਗਣਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Aapu Gavaai N Aapu Ganaaiaa.
translation: The Gurmukhs erase their ego and never allow themselves to be noticed.
Effacing duality, they venerate only one Lord.
Accepting Guru as God they by cultivating the words of the Guru, translate them into life.
The Gurmukhs serve and attain the fruits of happiness.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਕਾਰ ਕਮਾੲਿ ਸੁਖ ਫਲੁ ਪਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Kaar Kamaai Soukh Phalu Paaiaa.
translation: This way receiving the cup of love,
They bear the effect of this unbearable in their mind.
Daily routine of the Gurmukh
The Guru-orientated gets up early in the morning and makes others also to do so.
Discarding delusions is equal to bathing at the holy places for him.
Gurmukh carefully and attentively recites the moolmantar.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਨਿਹਚਲੁ ਹੋੲਿ ੲਿਕ ਮਨਿ ਧਿਅਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Nihachalu Hoi Ik Mani Dhiaaiaa.
translation: The Gurmukh single-mindedly concentrates upon the Lord.
The red mark of love adorns his forehead.

gurmukhi: ਪੈਰੀ ਪੈ ਗੁਰ ਸਿਖ ਪੈਰੀ ਪਾੲਿਅਾ ॥੫॥
transliteration: Pairee Pai Gur Sikh Pairee Paaiaa ?5?
translation: Falling on the feet of the Sikhs of the Guru and thus through his own humility, he makes others surrender to his feet.
The earning of Gurmukh
Touching the feet, the Sikhs of the Guru wash their feet.

transliteration: Anmrit Vaanee Chakhi Manu Vasi Aaiaa.
translation: Then they taste the ambrosial word (of Guru) through which the mind is controlled.
They fetch water, fan the sangat and put wood in the firebox of the kitchen.
They listen to, write and make others write the hymns of the Gurus.
They practice the remembrance of Lords name, charity and ablutions.

gurmukhi: ਨਿਵ ਚਲਣੁ ਮਿਠ ਬੋਲ ਘਾਲਿ ਖਵਾੲਿਅਾ ॥੬॥
transliteration: Niv Chalanu Mitd Bol Ghaali Khavaaiaa ?6?
translation: They walk in humility, speak sweetly, and eat the earning of their own hands.
Metting of the Sikhs of the Guru
The Sikhs of Guru meet the Sikhs of the Guru.
Bound by the loving devotion, they celebrate the anniversaries of the Guru.
For them, the Sikh of the Guru is the god, goddess and the father.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਸਿਖ ਮਾਂ ਪਿੳੁ ਵੀਰ ਕੁਟੰਬ ਸਬਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Gurasikh Maan Piu Veer Koutanb Sabaaiaa.
translation: Mother, father, brother and the family also is the Sikh of the Guru.
Meeting to the Sikhs of the Guru is farming business as well as other gainful occupations for the Sikh.
The progeny of the swan like Sikhs of Guru is also the Sikh of the Guru.
Omens

gurmukhi: ਸਜਾ ਖਬਾ ਸੳੁਣੁ ਨ ਮੰਨਿ ਵਸਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Sajaa Khabaa Saounu N Manni Vasaaiaa.
translation: The Gurmukhs never take to their heart the omen on the right or the left.

gurmukhi: ਨਾਰਿ ਪੁਰਖ ਨੋ ਵੇਖਿ ਨ ਪੈਰੁ ਹਟਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Naari Purakh No Vaykhi N Pairu Hataaiaa.
translation: They do not retrace their steps while seeing a man or woman.

gurmukhi: ਭਾਖ ਸੁਭਾਖ ਵੀਚਾਰਿ ਨ ਛਿਕ ਮਨਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Bhaakh Soubhaakh Veechaari N Chhik Manaaiaa.
translation: They do not pay attention to the crises of animals or sneezing.

gurmukhi: ਦੇਵੀ ਦੇਵ ਨ ਸੇਵ ਨ ਪੂਜ ਕਰਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Dayvee Dayv N Sayvi N Pooj Karaaiaa.
translation: Goddess and gods are neither served nor worshipped by them.

gurmukhi: ਭੰਭਲ ਭੂਸੇ ਖਾੲਿ ਨ ਮਨ ਭਰਮਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Bhanbhal Bhoosay Khaai N Manu Bharamaaiaa.
translation: By not entangling in deceits, they do not allow their minds to wander.
The Gursikhs have sowed the seed of truth in the field of life and have made it fruitful.
Holy congregation, abode the truth

gurmukhi: ਕਿਰਤ ਵਿਰਤਿ ਮਨੁ ਧਰਮੁ ਸਚੁ ਦਿੜਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Kirati Virati Manu Dharamu Sachu Dirhaaiaa.
translation: For earning livelihood, the Gurmukhs keep in mind, the dharma and always remember the truth.
They know that the creator himself has created (and diffused) the truth.

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਪੁਰਖੁ ਦੲਿਅਾਲੁ ਦੲਿਅਾ ਕਰਿ ਅਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Satigur Purakhu Daiaalu Daiaa Kari Aaiaa.
translation: That true Guru, the supreme one, compassionately has descended on earth.
Personifying the formless into the form of Word He has recited it for one and all.
The Guru has founded the high mound of the holy congregation known also as the abode of truth.
There only establishing the true throne he has made all to bow and salute.
Services to the holy congregation
The Sikhs of the Guru inspire the Sikhs of the Guru to serve.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਕਰਿ ਸੇਵ ਸੁਖ ਫਲੁ ਪਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Saadhasangati Kari Sayv Soukh Phalu Paaiaa.
translation: Serving the holy congregation they receive the fruit of happiness.
Sweeping and spreading the sitting mats they bathe in the dust of the holy congregation.
They bring unused pitchers and fill them with water (to get it cold).
They bring sacred food (maha parshad), distribute it among others and eat.

gurmukhi: ੧੧ ਬੁਰੇ ਨਾਲ ਭਲਾ ਕਰਨ ਦੇ ਵਿਖੇ
translation: Do good to evil person
Tree is there in the world and keeps its head downward.
It stands steadfast and maintains its head low.

gurmukhi: ਹੋੲਿ ਸੁਫਲ ਫਲ ਸਫਲੁ ਵਟ ਸਹਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Hoi Suphal Phalu Saphalu Vat Sahaaiaa.
translation: Then becoming full of fruits it bears the stone-blows.
Further it gets sawed and causes to make ship.

gurmukhi: ਪਾਣੀ ਦੇ ਸਿਰਿ ਵਾਟ ਰਾਹੁ ਚਲਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Paanee Day Siri Vaat Raahu Chalaaiaa.
translation: Now it moves on the head of water.
Having borne iron-saw upon head, it carries the same iron (used in ship making) across the water.
The tree bears the evil and does the good
With the help of iron the tree is cut and pruned and iron nails are stuck into it.
But the tree carry iron on its head keeps it floating on water.

gurmukhi: ਅਾਪਨੜਾ ਪੁਤੁ ਪਾਲਿ ਨ ਨੀਰਿ ਡੁਬਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Aapanarhaa Poutu Paali N Neeri Doubaaiaa.
translation: The water also considering it its adopted son does not make it sink.
But the sandalwood is sunk intentionally to make it costlier.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਣ ਕੀਤੇ ਗੁਣ ਹੋੲਿ ਜਗੁ ਪਤੀਅਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Goun Keetay Goun Hoi Jagu Pateeaaiaa.
translation: The quality of goodness produces goodness and the whole world also remains happy.

gurmukhi: ਅਵਗੁਣ ਸਹਿ ਗੁਣੁ ਕਰੈ ਘੋਲਿ ਘੁਮਾੲਿਅਾ ॥੧੨॥
transliteration: Avagoun Sahi Gounu Karai Gholi Ghoumaaiaa ?12?
translation: I am sacrifice unto him who does good in return of evil.
Orders of the true Guru
Who accepts the order (will) of Lord makes the whole world accept His order (Hukam).
The order of the Guru is that the will of the Lord be accepted positively.
Drinking the cup of loving devotion, they visualise the invisible (Lord).

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਅਲਖੁ ਲਖਾੲਿ ਨ ਅਲਖੁ ਲਖਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Alakhu Lakhaai N Alakhu Lakhaaiaa.
translation: The Gurmukhs even having seen (realised) do not go on divulging this mystery.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਅਾਪੁ ਗਵਾੲਿ ਨ ਅਾਪੁ ਗਣਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Aapu Gavaai N Aapu Ganaaiaa.
translation: Gurmukhs delete ego from the self and never allow themselves to be noticed.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸੁਖ ਫਲੁ ਪਾੲਿ ਬੀਜ ਫਲਾੲਿਅਾ ॥੧੩॥
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Paai Beej Phalaaiaa ?13?
translation: The Guru-orientated ones acquire the fruit of happiness and spread its seeds all around.
Love of a disciple
Having the sight of the true Guru, the Sikh of the Guru concentrates upon Him.
Pondering upon the word of true Guru he cultivates knowledge.

gurmukhi: ਚਰਣ ਕਵਲ ਗੁਰ ਮੰਤੁ ਚਿਤਿ ਵਸਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Charan Kaval Gur Mantu Chiti Vasaaiaa.
translation: He keeps to his heart the mantra and the lotus feet of Guru.
He serves the true Guru and consequently makes the whole world serve him.
The Guru loves disciple and disciple makes the whole world happy.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਪੰਥੁ ਚਲਾੲਿ ਨਿਜ ਘਰਿ ਛਾੲਿਅਾ ॥੧੪॥
transliteration: Guramoukhi Pandu Chalaai Nij Ghari Chhaaiaa ?14?
translation: This way, that disciple creates a religion of the Gurmukhs and situates in his own self.
Yoga-technique for Gurmukh
Guru has explained the technique of yoga to the Sikhs.
Remain detached amidst all the hopes and cravings.
Eat less food and drink little water.

gurmukhi: ਥੋੜਾ ਬੋਲਣ ਬੋਲ ਨ ਝਖਿ ਝਖਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Dorhaa Bolan Boli N Jhakhi Jhakhaaiaa.
translation: Speak less and do not talk nonsensical.

gurmukhi: ਥੋੜੀ ਰਾਤੀ ਨੀਦ ਨ ਮੋਹਿ ਫਹਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Dorhee Raatee Need N Mohi Dhahaaiaa.
translation: Sleep less and do not be caught in any infatuation.

gurmukhi: ਸੁਹਣੇ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਜਾੲਿ ਨ ਲੋਭ ਲੁਭਾੲਿਅਾ ॥੧੫॥
transliteration: Suhanay Andari Jaai N Lobh Loubhaaiaa ?15?
translation: Sleep less and do not be caught in any infatuation.
Yoga-technique for Gursikhs
The sermon of the Guru is the earrings of a yogi.

gurmukhi: ਖਿੰਥਾ ਖਿਮਾ ਸਿਵਾੲਿ ਝੋਲੀ ਪਤਿ ਮਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Khindaa Khimaa Sivaai Jholee Pati Maaiaa.
translation: Forgiveness is the patched blanket and in the beggar's bad is the name of the Lord of maya (God).

transliteration: Pairee Pai Paa Khaak Bibhoot Banaaiaa.
translation: Humbly touching of the feet ashes.
Cup of love is the bowl, which is filled with the food of affection.
Knowledge is the staff with which the messengers of different propensities of mind are cultured.
Holy congregation is the tranquil cave wherein the yogi resides in equipoise.
Other means of yoga-technique for  Gursikhs
The knowledge about the supreme is the trumpet (singi) of yogi and the recitation of the word is its playing upon.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਅਾੲੀ ਪੰਥੁ ਨਿਜ ਘਰੁ ਅਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Aaee Pandu Nij Gharu Aaiaa.
translation: The best assembly of gurmukhs i.e. the Ai panth, could be attained by settling in one's own home.
Such people (Gurmukhs) bow before the primal Lord and have the sight of the invisible (God).
The disciples and the Gurus have enrapt themselves in the mutual love for one another.
Getting above of the worldly affairs, they meet (their ultimate destiny) the Lord.
World, the game of dice

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਸਿਖ ਸੁਣਿ ਗੁਰਸਿਖ ਸਿਖ ਸਦਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Gur Sikh Souni Gurasikh Sikhu Sadaaiaa.
translation: Having listened to the teaching of Guru,
The Sikh of Guru has called other Sikhs.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਸਿਖ ਸੁਣਿ ਕਰਿ ਭਾੳੁ ਮੰਨਿ ਵਸਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Gur Sikh Souni Kari Bhaau Manni Vasaaiaa.
translation: Adopting the teachings of the Guru,
The Sikh has recited the same to others.

transliteration: Gur Sikh Gurasikh Sangu Mayli Milaaiaa.
translation: The Sikhs of the Guru have liked the Sikhs and thus a Sikh has met the Sikhs.

gurmukhi: ਚੳੁਪੜਿ ਸੋਲਹ ਸਾਰ ਜੁਗ ਜਿਣਿ ਅਾੲਿਅਾ ॥੧੮॥
transliteration: Chaouparhi Solah Saar Joug Jini Aaiaa ?18?
translation: The pair of the Guru and the disciple has conquered the world-game of oblong dice.
The game of chess
The chess players have spread the chess mat.
Elephants, chariots, horses and pedestrians have been brought in.

gurmukhi: ਹੁੲਿ ਪਤਿਸਾਹੁ ਵਜੀਰ ਦੁੲਿ ਦਲ ਛਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Hui Patisaahu Vajeer Dui Dal Chhaaiaa.
translation: The groups of kings and ministers have gathered and are fighting tooth and nail.
The groups of kings and ministers have gathered and are fighting tooth and nail.
The Gurmukh by making a move has opened his heart before the Guru.
The Guru has lifted pedestrian to the rank of minister and has placed him in the palace of success (and thus has saved the life game of the disciple).
Living in the fear of God, Gurmukhs attain formless God

gurmukhi: ਭੈ ਵਿਚਿ ਨਿਮਣਿ ਨਿਮਿ ਭੈ ਵਿਚ ਜਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Bhai Vichi Nimani Nimi Bhai Vichi Jaaiaa.
translation: Under the natural law (fear of lord), the jiva (creature) is conceived (by mother) and in the fear (law) he is born.

gurmukhi: ਭੈ ਵਿਚਿ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਪੰਥਿ ਸਰਣੀ ਅਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Bhai Vichi Guramoukhi Panthi Saranee Aaiaa.
translation: In fear he comes in the shelter of the way (panth) of Guru.

gurmukhi: ਭੈ ਵਿਚਿ ਸੰਗਤਿ ਸਾਧ ਸਬਦੁ ਕਮਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Bhai Vichi Sangati Saadh Sabadu Kamaaiaa.
translation: In fear while in the holy congregation he earns the merit of the True Word

gurmukhi: ਭੈ ਵਿਚਿ ਜੀਵਨੁ ਮੁਕਤਿ ਭਾਣਾ ਭਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Bhai Vichi Jeevanu Moukati Bhaanaa Bhaaiaa.
translation: In fear (natural laws) he gets liberated in life and accepts the will of God happily.

gurmukhi: ਭੈ ਵਿਚਿ ਜਨਮੁ ਸਵਾਰਿ ਸਹਜਿ ਸਮਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Bhai Vichi Janamu Savaari Sahaji Samaaiaa.
translation: In fear he leaves away this life and merges in equipoise.

gurmukhi: ਭੈ ਵਿਚਿ ਨਿਜ ਘਰਿ ਜਾੲਿ ਪੂਰਾ ਪਾੲਿਅਾ ॥੨੦॥
transliteration: Bhai Vichi Nij Ghari Jaai Pooraa Paaiaa ?20?
translation: In fear he settles in his self and attains the supreme Perfect Being.
In praise of the Guru
Those who, accepting Guru as God have sought shelter in the Lord.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਚਰਣੀ ਚਿਤੁ ਲਾੲਿ ਨ ਚਲੈ ਚਲਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Gur Charanee Chitu Laai N Chalai Chalaaiaa.
translation: Those who have put their heart at the feet of Lord, never become perishable.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮਤਿ ਨਿਹਚਲ ਹੋੲਿ ਨਿਜ ਪਦੁ ਪਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Guramati Nihachalu Hoi Nij Pad Paaiaa.
translation: They, getting deeply rooted in the wisdom of Guru, attain themselves.
They adopt the daily routine of the Gurmukhs, and Gods Will becomes dear to them.
As Gurmukhs, losing their ego, they merge in the truth.

gurmukhi: ਸਫਲੁ ਜਨਮੁ ਜਗਿ ਅਾੲਿ ਜਗਤੁ ਤਰਾੲਿਅਾ ॥੨੧॥
transliteration: Saphalu Janamu Jagi Aai Jagatu Taraaiaa ?21?20?veeha?
translation: Their birth in the world is meaningful and they across the whole world also.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸੁਖਫਲ ਦੲਿਅਾ ਕੈ ਦਿਖਾਵੈ ਜਾਹਿ ਤਾਹਿ ਅਾਨ ਰੂਪ ਰੰਗ ਦੇਖੇ ਨਾਹੀ ਭਾਵੲੀ
transliteration: Gurmukhi Soukhaphal Daiaa Kai Dikhaavai Jaahi , Taahi Aan Roop Rang Daykhay Naahee Bhaavaee ?
translation: One who is blessed by Satguru with spiritual wisdom, he does not like to see any other form or attraction. Nothing else can give tranquility and peace to such a blessed person.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸੁਖਫਲ ਮੲਿਅਾ ਕੈ ਚਖਾਵੈ ਜਾਹਿ ਤਾਹਿ ਅਨਰਸ ਨਹੀਂ ਰਸਨਾ ਹਿਤਾਵਹੀ
transliteration: Gurmukhi Soukhaphal Maiaa Kai Chakhaavai Jaahi , Taahi Anaras Naheen Rasanaa Hitaavahee ?
translation: One who is blessed with spiritual pleasure by the True Guru, he does not relish any other pleasures.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸੁਖਫਲ ਅਗਹੁ ਗਹਾਵੈ ਜਾਹਿ ਸਰਬ ਨਿਧਾਨ ਪਰਸਨ ਕੳੁ ਨ ਧਾਵੲੀ
transliteration: Gurmukhi Soukhaphal Agahu Gahaavai Jaahi , Sarab Nidhaan Parasan Kau N Dhaavaee ?
translation: A devout Sikh who is blessed with the spiritual pleasure that no one can reach to, he need not run after other worldly relishments.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸੁਖਫਲ ਅਲਖ ਲਖਾਵੈ ਜਾਹਿ ਅਕਥ ਕਥਾ ਬਿਨੋਦ ਵਾਹੀ ਬਨਿ ਅਾਵੲੀ ॥੨੦॥
transliteration: Gurmukhi Soukhaphal Alakh Lakhaavai Jaahi , Akad Kadaa Binod Vaahee Bani Aavaee ?20?
translation: Only he who is blessed with self-realization (spiritual knowledge) can feel its pleasure and this cannot be explained. The devotee himself can only appreciate the pleasure of that state. (20)
